intro: Oenanthe digitata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved water dropwort, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often submerged or floating in shallow water. It is typically found in wetlands, stream margins, and other moist environments. Oenanthe digitata is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables.
